citeinfo.title: transek8_20250626_001634_forecast_20 - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 5.1.20230124.1520 Forecast Feature Class

descript.purpose: This dataset consists of a polyline file representing the Digital Shoreline Analysis System version 5 (DSAS v5) beta shoreline forecast at a 10- or 20-year time horizon. New to DSAS v5 is an option to calculate a shoreline position either 10 or 20 years into the future based on historical shoreline positions. The method assimilates shoreline observations (shoreline position change, shoreline uncertainty) then estimates process noise to forecast the shoreline position and provide a quantitative estimate of uncertainty for the forecast.

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS version 5 software applications and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains a polyline shoreline representing the possible location of a shoreline in the future and was generated by the beta Shoreline Forecasting tool in the DSAS version 5 software application.

procstep.procdesc: Transect features generated using DSAS v5.1.20230124.1520. Parameters Used: baseline layer=Baseline, baseline group field=NULL, transect spacing=50 meters, search distance=5000 meters, land direction=right, shoreline intersection=seaward, File produced = transek8 .For additional details on these parameters, please see the DSAS help file distributed with the DSAS software, or visit the USGS website at: https://woodshole.er.usgs.gov/project-pages/DSAS/

Shoreline intersects and rate calculations performed. Parameters Used: shoreline layer=Shorelines, shoreline date field=DATE_, shoreline uncertainty field name=UNCERTAINTY, the default accuracy=1.5 meters, shoreline intersection=seaward, stats calculations=[SCE, NSM, EPR, LRR], shoreline threshold=none, confidence interval=95%. Files produced = transek8_rates_20250626_001634 , transek8_intersect_20250626_001634 .

Shoreline forecast (polyline and point) and forecast uncertainty (polygon) calculated. A = 20 year shoreline forecast with uncertainty was performed using: input rate file (containing LRR values used in forecasting) = transek8_rates_20250626_001634, and intersect file = transek8_intersect_20250626_001634. Files produced = transek8_20250626_001634_forecast_20 , transek8_20250626_001634_forecast_uncy_20 , transek8_20250626_001634_forecast_points .

enttyp.enttypd: Shoreline forecasts are generated by DSAS using the linear regression rate (LRR) value from the transect rate file with the same timestamp.

attr.attrdef: The object identification field is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It establishes a unique ID for each row in the attribute table.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The geometry field (shape) is automatically created and maintained by ArcGIS. It provides a definition of the feature type (point, line, polygon).
The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).

edom.edomvd: The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).
The number of years the forecast is modeling (10/20).

attr.attrdef: The year the forecast represents (date of model run +10/20 years).

attrdomv.udom: The forecast year is the shoreline forecast horizion at either 10 or 20 years from the current date at the time the forecast is calculated.

attr.attrdef: Length of shoreline forecast polyline in meter units, assuming data was properly projected in a meter-based coordinate system. This field is automatically generated and maintained when data is within a geodatabase.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
